contentrichtext.text: '''River Stour''' may refer to: *[[River Stour, Dorset]], a river in the English county of Dorset *[[River Stour, Kent]], a river in the English county of Kent *[[River Stour, Suffolk]], a river in the English counties of Suffolk and Essex *[[River Stour, Warwickshire]], a river in the English county of Warwickshire *[[River Stour, Worcestershire]], a river in the English county of Worcestershire *[[River East Stour]], a river in the English county of Kent *[[River Great Stour]], a river in the English county of Kent *[[River Little Stour]], a river in the English county of Kent <!-- The [[hydronym|river-name]] ''Stour'', very common in England, does not occur at all in Wales;<ref>O.G.S. Crawford, "Celtic place-names in England", ''The Archaeological Journal'' (British Archaeological Association) 2nd ser. '''27''' 1920:144; Crawford noted two tributaries of the [[Po]] near Turin, spelled ''Sture''.</ref> it is of ambiguous origin: recently<ref>Richard Coates, "Stour and Blyth as English river-names" ''English Language and Linguistics'' '''10''' Cambridge University Press (2006:23-29).</ref> it has been suggested that an [[Old European]] river-name was taken for an [[Old English]] adjective. --> ==See also== *[[Rivers of the United Kingdom]] *[[Stour (disambiguation)]] {{geodis}}
